document_data.name: Royal Gorget of Battle
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Royal Gorget of Battle''''' was an [[enchanted]] [[gorget]] in possession of the [[Obarskyr|royal family]] of [[Cormyr]].
document_data.Powers: The powers, while nondescript, were largely defensive in nature.
document_data.History:
The ''Gorget'' was loaned by [[Elminster Aumar]], [[wizard]] and [[Chosen of Mystra]], to King [[Palaghard Obarskyr I]] of Cormyr before his reign to ensure his safety. Palaghard in turn let it be worn by his wife [[Enchara]], with Elminster's blessing. Afterwards, it was left in the [[Warhorn Room]], displayed as a state treasure of Cormyr.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|11|1}}

On [[Mirtul 5]] of the {{yearlinkName|1479}}, Elminster stole the ''Gorget'' from its display case, unaware that [[Vainrence]] had cast a tracing spell on it.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|28|3}} The tracing spell eventually drew a force of mages bearing orders to retrieve the ''Gorget'' or utterly annihilate Elminster; they persisted in this endeavor upon catching up with him, despite his protestations.
